Class Library

java.lang.Object
Library
public class Library
extends java.lang.Object
The Library class is responsible for creating and maintaining a "bag", or array, of type Book. It holds multiple methods that revolve around maintaining and manipulating this bag in order to serve as an effective library.
Author:
Anuraj Dubey, Chenghao Lin

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int BAG_GROW_VALUE  
    private Book[] books  
    static int NOT_FOUND  
    private int numBooks  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Library()
    This is a contructor to create an initial empty bag of type Book.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void add​(Book book)
    This method adds a given inputted book at the end of the bag.
    boolean checkOut​(Book book)
    This method checks out a book by setting the book's "checkedOut" value to true.
    private int find​(Book book)
    This is a method to find a certain book in the bag, given and input of type Book.
    int getNumBooks()
    This method returns the number of books in the bag if needed.
    private void grow()
    This is a method to grow the bag by a given value of 4, anytime the bag gets overfilled by books.
    void print()
    This method prints out all books in the bag in a sequence.
    void printByDate()
    This method prints out all books in the bag, by ascending order of the published dates.
    void printByNumber()
    This method prints out all books in the bag, by ascending order of the serial numbers.
    boolean remove​(Book book)
    This method removes a given book from the bag by setting that respective index to null.
    boolean returns​(Book book)
    This method returns a checked out book by setting its checkedOut() value to false.
    Book search​(int number)
    This method is used to search for a book in the bag with an inputted serial/book number for convenience if needed.

  • Constructor Details

    • Library

      public Library()
      This is a contructor to create an initial empty bag of type Book.

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find​(Book book)
      This is a method to find a certain book in the bag, given and input of type Book.
      Parameters:
      book - that is trying to be found
      Returns:
      i, the index of the book being searched for.

    • grow

      private void grow()
      This is a method to grow the bag by a given value of 4, anytime the bag gets overfilled by books. It creates a new bag and copies the old bag into this new one.

    • add

      public void add​(Book book)
      This method adds a given inputted book at the end of the bag.
      Parameters:
      book - being added into the bag

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Book book)
      This method removes a given book from the bag by setting that respective index to null. Additionally, it shifts books further in the bag to the left following the removal. This readjustment is to make sure there is no empty spot in the middle of the bag.
      Parameters:
      book - being removed from the bag
      Returns:
      true if the removal was successful, or false if the removal was unsuccessful.

    • checkOut

      public boolean checkOut​(Book book)
      This method checks out a book by setting the book's "checkedOut" value to true.
      Parameters:
      book - being checked out
      Returns:
      true if check out was successful, or false if it was unsuccessful.

    • returns

      public boolean returns​(Book book)
      This method returns a checked out book by setting its checkedOut() value to false.
      Parameters:
      book - being returned
      Returns:
      true if return was successful, or false if return was unsuccessful.

    • print

      public void print()
      This method prints out all books in the bag in a sequence.

    • printByDate

      public void printByDate()
      This method prints out all books in the bag, by ascending order of the published dates. It uses a selection sort algorithm to sort all the books in the bag.

    • printByNumber

      public void printByNumber()
      This method prints out all books in the bag, by ascending order of the serial numbers. It uses a selection sort algorithm to sort all the books in the bag.

    • search

      public Book search​(int number)
      This method is used to search for a book in the bag with an inputted serial/book number for convenience if needed.
      Parameters:
      number - (serial number) of the book
      Returns:
      this returns the book object being searched for, or returns null if not found.

    • getNumBooks

      public int getNumBooks()
      This method returns the number of books in the bag if needed.
      Returns:
      returns the number of books.
